profiles: Summary Managed software development on successful projects for over 10 years, including frontend, backend, desktop, and mobile systems. Led local, distributed, and offshore teams of up to 30 engineers. Experience Senior Software Engineering Manager Stanford University September 2010  – Present (5 years) Palo Alto, CA Managed software engineering team and overall coordination for the 8 sites participating in a $3.6M/year project to provide access to standardized biomedical vocabularies to a worldwide community. Led a team of 8 engineers in 4 locations developing a Web portal and a platform of REST Web services. External users have built over 100 applications on this platform. Software Consultant and Contractor various March 2010  –  September 2010  (7 months) Redword City, CA Developed prototype for Web advertising inventory management system (IMS) for mobile phone advertising client. Prototype predicted number of targeted ads available in the future.  Director of Engineering Bluepulse March 2009  –  July 2009  (5 months) Sunnyvale, CA Led team developing mobile phone application that allowed users to retrieve information with spoken commands (cf. Apple’s Siri). Team consisted of 7 employees and contractors at 2 sites, and included frontend and backend development, QA, and operations. Company closed in Aug 2009. Senior Software Engineering Manager Yahoo! November 2005  –  February 2009  (3 years 4 months) Sunnyvale, CA Managed software development for Yahoo’s display advertising inventory, supply forecasting, and pricing systems. These components are a key part of Yahoo's premium display advertising business. Software Manager and Technical Lead Stanford University September 1994  –  November 2005  (11 years 3 months) Palo Alto, CA Led the design and construction of the Protégé open-source modeling tool. Protégé is similar to an object-oriented database schema designer; system builders use it to create complex, adaptable applications. Independent evaluations rated Protégé superior to alternatives for robustness and usability. Protégé is now the de facto worldwide standard tool in its domain. Software Engineer Centigram 1989  –  1994  (5 years) San Jose, CA Centigram was a startup telecommunications (voicemail) company that had an IPO in 1993. Enhanced systems software for processing recorded voice, text, and generated speech. Experience Lab Manager Stanford University February 2013  – Present (2 years 7 months) Stanford, CA Lab manager at the Stanford Nanofabrication Facility on the Stanford Campus. Process Engineering Manager Stanford University 2001  – Present (14 years) Stanford, CA Senior researcher and technical staff member at the Stanford Nanofabrication Facility (SNF), a shared resource open to researchers from companies and other universities as well as Stanford and serving over 500 researchers annually. Job responsibilities include: process staff manager, technical liaison for bio/biotech/medical research projects, lab facilities support coordinator, lab safety manager, project manager. Primary function is to enable the research of the SNF labmembers by providing them tools, training, and expertise. Biology Domain Expert Stanford University 1998  –  2001  (3 years) Stanford, CA Research Associate at the Stanford Nanofabrication Facility (SNF). Responsible for recruiting and providing technical support for biology-based research projects at SNF. Organized educational workshops and conferences in topics such as: biomedical devices, MEMS for biologists, DNA microchips for engineers, nanosafety practice and ethics. Wrote grants and advised/participated in research projects; mentored undergraduates, lectured and supported lab-related course work. Post Doctoral Researcher UC Berkeley 1997  –  1998  (1 year) Berkeley, CA Research topic: the development of microfluidic devices for DNA sequencing analysis in the lab of Prof. Richard A. Mathies, Department of Chemistry. Process Engineer/Sr Process Eng Intel Corporation 1984  –  1991  (7 years) Santa Clara, CA Experience working in the following functional areas: plasma etch, plasma enhanced chemical vapor deposition, photolithography, quality control, integration. Summary I am a senior engineering executive experienced in building and managing agile engineering groups in start-up and large organizations. With strong people management skills, many years of agile management experience working with industry leaders i.e. ThoughtWorks and PivotalLabs and deep technical expertise in web and mobile development, video technologies, advertising and big data, I focus on getting things done, at all levels, and I have done it consistently. I have grown top-notch teams and designed, built, shipped/deployed and maintained multiple successful commercial software products.  
 
Currently I am the Software Development Manager for the Industrial Mobility team at GE Software. We are building an Industrial Mobility Platform that will be used to deliver the Right Information, to the Right Person, at the Right Time enabling Shorter Response Times that lead to a more efficient and effective mobile workforce (see http://www.wired.com/design/2013/10/three-design-trends-ges-using-to-make-software-for-jet-engines-and-wind-turbines/) 
 
Previously I held engineering management positions working on both enterprise and consumer applications. I have recruited, retained, mentored and managed engineering managers, team leads, software engineers, UX designers and QA staff, through various stages of growth.  
 
Specialties 
 
Technology strategy, organizational development, product process/agile methodologies, startups and vendor management. Software engineering in numerous stacks, large-scale high-availability systems and cloud architectures, "big data" collection & processing, online advertising tech, mobile application development, video platforms, social network integration and APIs. In particular, I enjoy using my skills in Python programming, web technologies, systems administration, and enterprise-class data storage to enable scientific data management and high performance computing.

Summary SUMMARY 
 
An intuitive and inquisitive Engineering Generalist, Systems Architect and Designer with extensive experience in computer driven systems. Highly developed strengths in digital hardware, computer systems, communications, machine vision, and the electronic, mechanical and optical design of complete systems. Skilled in managing research and development programs, conceptualizing and implementing new ideas from early stage to finished product. A strong problem solver and "big picture" thinker who rapidly masters new technologies and can develop alternative approaches. Engineering Fellow Catapult Communications January 1995  –  June 2009  (14 years 6 months) Investigated new product ideas for strategic and tactical value and opportunity. 
· Conducted technical evaluation of potential acquisition targets. 
· Provided technical problem solving, evaluation and project management support for 
engineering and manufacturing activities. 
· Trained engineers in new technologies. 
Manager, Product Design (1995-2006) 
Managed the Hardware Development Group with up to five Senior Hardware Engineers engaged 
in system and hardware design on new communications testing products. 
· Architected new PCI and cPCI (with high speed mesh backplane interconnect) based 
communications testing systems. 
· Designed co-processor modules with PowerPC communications processors for installation 
into PCI workstations and cPCI mesh connected shelves. 
· Designed physical interfaces including DS3, E3, ATM 155 UTP, and ATM 155/622 Optical. 
· Developed JTAG test programs and diagnostics for manufacturing test. Technical Director DE LA RUE GIORI OF AMERICA January 1987  –  January 1995  (8 years 1 month) Provided overall technical direction of all company operations. 
· Served as chief system architect of a very large image processing system for the automatic in- 
process inspection of newly printed security documents. 
· Principal Designer of a massive parallel processing pipelined computer system consisting of 51 
CCD color cameras, a 22 CPU distributed control computer and 300 custom VMEbus image 
processing modules (18 types) running at a data rate greater than 400 megabytes/second. 
· Developed system specifications by surveying/interviewing potential worldwide customer base. 
· Created specifications and supervised design and production for a paper transport system built 
by an Italian company. Manager, Research & Development MACHINE INTELLIGENCE CORPORATION January 1980  –  January 1987  (7 years 1 month) Managed company new product development efforts. 
· Designed first commercially available practical industrial vision system. 
· Led joint venture (Yaskawa Electric) design team in the development of a vision system for an 
industrial robotics product line. 
· Provided major contributions to the definition and design of sensor/hardware/software systems 
for automatic inspection and measuring equipment in the automotive and electronics industries. 
· Conducted feasibility studies for automatic examination of security documents leading to 
formation of company. Hardware and Systems Design Consultant Silicon January 1979  –  January 1980  (1 year 1 month) Provided technical expertise and assistance on a variety of projects to clients including Sun 
Microsystems, Hewlett Packard, Imagen, Xerox, Catapult Communications and Hexcel. 
· Installed computer aided design systems, computer interface design and construction, ISDN 
test interface design and automation of a 5-axis milling machine. Vice President, Engineering STANFORD SYSTEMS January 1978  –  January 1979  (1 year 1 month) Responsible for new product idea generation and development. 
· Explored concepts in computer aided design, computer graphics terminals, and computer 
networks and communication. Engineering Manager Stanford University January 1968  –  January 1978  (10 years 1 month) Maintained advanced computer systems. 
· Developed new hardware for artificial intelligence and other computer based technologies. 
· Contributed to projects dedicated to robotics and industrial automation, machine vision, music 
and acoustics, computer graphics, ARPA Net, and computer aided design systems.
